name: camestres
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(wn(w2), wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(wn(w2), wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wal(s0, wi(wn(w2), wn(w1))), wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(wn(w2), wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wal(s0, wi(wn(w2), wn(w1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wal(s0, wi(wn(w2), wn(w1))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wal(s0, wi(wn(w2), wn(w1))))
-| wi(wi(w1, w2), wi(wn(w2), wn(w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wi(wi(w1, w2), wi(wn(w2), wn(w1)))

|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))

comment: "Camestres", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. All ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and no ` ch ` is ` ps ` , therefore no ` ch ` is ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, AEE-2: PaM and SeM therefore SeP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
